evidence_items.text: A tug driving instructor (tug instructor) and trainee tug driver (trainee driver) were seated beside each other in the tug. The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so. The headset operator continued walking on the right side of the tug, abeam its cabin. The wingman was on the left just ahead of the tug.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.
The tug instructor pulled the aircraft forward off the fence then stopped the tug.

roots_spec.exclusion_clause: Not explained by any other root

defeaters: If evidence showed clear procedural deviation without communication issues
If mechanical faults were identified corroborating failure
If environmental or marking deficiencies explained the incident

quotes.exact_quote: A tug driving instructor (tug instructor) and trainee tug driver (trainee driver) were seated beside each other in the tug. The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so. The headset operator continued walking on the right side of the tug, abeam its cabin. The wingman was on the left just ahead of the tug.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.
The tug instructor pulled the aircraft forward off the fence then stopped the tug.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H1-H3 shows active communication and coordination attempts among crew, but H4-H5 indicate a failure to stop at the TRP leading to collision, supporting presence of communication/coordination breakdown. Discriminators favor communication breakdown over mechanical failure or marking deficiency.
outcome.uncertainty_source: ambiguity in whether procedural deviation or communication breakdown is primary cause

defeaters: If evidence showed clear procedural adherence without communication issues

quotes.exact_quote: The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.
After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H1-H3 shows communication and procedural actions by operators, and H4 indicates the aircraft moved beyond expected points without mechanical fault evidence, favoring communication breakdown, procedural deviation, or environment deficiency over mechanical failure.

If markings were confirmed adequate and visible, this would weaken the claim.
outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence indicates presence or observability of environmental or marking deficiency on the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the specified timeframe; evidence focuses on crew actions and pushback events without marking or environmental condition details.

node.statement: The procedural deviation in pushback execution is documented and available within the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 historical baseline t1 early dataset.

assumptions: The historical baseline t1 early dataset includes the documented historical events (H1-H5).
No contradictory evidence exists in the dataset regarding the availability of procedural deviation documentation.
defeaters: If the dataset did not include these documented events or if evidence showed mechanical faults or environmental marking issues causing the deviation, the claim would be weakened.

quotes.exact_quote: The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

outcome.reasoning_summary: The historical evidence (H1-H5) directly documents the procedural deviation during pushback, including the continuation beyond the Tug release point and the instructor taking over, supporting availability of this deviation in the dataset. This evidence also favors procedural deviation over communication breakdown, environmental marking deficiency, or mechanical failure as discriminators.
outcome.uncertainty_source: No explicit mention of dataset contents; assumption that historical events are included in the dataset.
